column4: If you can get to a cli from the recovery kernel at grub it will be easier to just install, from a live cd you would have to chroot.
I can't seem to get in the grub menu… Aren't I supposed to hold the shift key down when I see my motherboard screen to load the grub menu?
should yes if you have only one OS, and you have not changed the timeout.
timeout?
grub has a time out that is the time you have to use it before it boots.
perhaps I should use a live cd to get the grub menu to stick at boot
What happened or what did you do that removed the graphics driver or make you think you had?
I put fglrx then wanted to switch back to the default one
I think you want help from someone more familiar with that stuff, my answer originally was just a easier method then using the cd.
Is this a install from windows perchance?
…Iv had ubuntu for a while, I was having problems booting today for some reason
But can you actually answer the question?
the answer is no
ah cool thanks, I was just wondering on that in regards to know grub, others are going to be more helpful than me here.
you there?
yeah.
i just got into grub, what should i do again? enter recover mode?
That was my idea as far as a easier then the cd method at messing with the graphics WHICH I KNOW NOTHING ABOUT.
and what do i do in recovry mode

You wanted to reload the graphics. You asked if from the cd was possible or best. My only remark was from a recovert terminal would be easier then having to chroot from a cd, That is where it ends as far as I know. Do you understand this, you can't just throw commands at the install from a cd without getting into the install a method used is called a chroot. I can't really help you.
I'm no longer using a cd
